ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Dynamical systems, ODEs in biological systems, Matlab, physics of phase separation.
Biology knowledge. Math and coding.
Knowledge of numerical systems and how to model them, overview of topics in neuro and soft matter physics. I knew much of the material before starting.
Insights of modeling various systems in biology from a math and physics point of view.
I learned a lot about how to code in matlab in this class. I believe the biomedical engineers including me did not know as much about math as our other classmates and that put us at a disadvantage.
Dynamical systems, liquid liquid phase transitions
Modeling neurons and LLPS computationally and analytically
modeling of biological system

Exciting explorations on topics on neuron circuit modeling and liquid-liquid phase transition. I have had an interest in those topics for a long time and this course has been a great opportunity to get a formal introduction to those topics.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Very good. Couldn't be better.

Strengths: I think it is well organized. Weakness: No solutions on hw or hackathon for us to check work. Could go more in-depth both in math and in coding i.e. visualization of a simulation. Should make more use of a textbook.
I think the p-sets and final project were a little too hard. I would spend days on them. Other than that, the class was good.
Very relevant topics for research

I liked the Hackathons that allowed us to perform simple simulations for better understanding. Weekly assignments helped a lot to follow up the course yet not demanding. Learning key concepts on each topic was the most valuable thing from this course.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. Interesting material, pleasant learning experience.
Yes. Well organized. Learned a lot. The workload is low, considering we learned so much.
Good for mbb/mcdb undergraduate who want to see how quantitive biology works.
It depends on how much they know about math and matlab, but I think I would.
Yes, very interesting topics with great instructors
Sure, depending on their experience and temperament.
I would highly recommend this course because it teaches you many things but not much workload
